He also asserted Google must focus on the development of technology that allows people to use their phones to do financial transactions. Phones, as we know, are used as banks in many poorer parts of the world- and modern technology means that their use as financial tools can go much further than that, he wrote. Finally, Eric Schmidt said Google would like to make inexpensive smartphones available to the most destitute regions of the planet. its current workers are located. In a speech Tuesday, Eric Schmidt said Google Inc. will hire more than 1,000 workers in Europe this year. All told, Google Inc. has more than 60 offices in 30 countries. At this stage, the number of opportunities just vastly exceed the number of people we have at the company, said Alan Eustace , Google Inc. 's senior vice president of engineering and research. Even if it surpasses 31,000 employees this year, Google Inc. will still have far fewer people than Microsoft Corp., among its fiercest rival.
